abstract: Iran's Foreign Min Mohammad Javad Zarif says country's negotiators are ready to begin drafting initial agreement on a nuclear accord; pace of negotiations is clearly intensifying as more foreign ministers begin arriving at talks, and most experts anticipate demanding late-night sessions as end-of-March deadline for deal approaches.
lead_paragraph: Mohammad Javad Zarif, the Iranian foreign minister, said Saturday that he had had productive discussions with his European counterparts about the remaining gaps in a nuclear accord.

headline.main: Iran’s Top Negotiator Says Accord Can Be Drafted
headline.print_headline: Iran’s Top Negotiator Says Accord Can Be Drafted

snippet: Mohammad Javad Zarif, the Iranian foreign minister, said Saturday that he had had productive discussions with his European counterparts about the remaining gaps in a nuclear accord.

keywords.value: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament
